Package de.db.derpate.util

Class AES256EncryptionUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.db.derpate.util.AES256EncryptionUtil
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EncryptionUtil
    public final class AES256EncryptionUtil
extends java.lang.Object
implements EncryptionUtil
    This util uses a 256 bit AES algorithm with Galois Counter Mode (GCM) provided by the SpringFramework.
    Author:
    MichelBlank
    See Also:
    TextEncryptor

      SpringFramework's BytesEncryptor says: "The provided salt is expected to be hex-encoded; it should be random and at least 8 bytes in length.

      static @Nullable java.lang.String decrypt​(@NonNull java.lang.String password, @NonNull java.lang.String salt, @NonNull java.lang.String encryptedText)
      Decrypts the given text (has to be hex-coded) with the provided password and salt.
      Caution: The salt has to be in hex format and has to have an even number of characters.

    • Field Detail

      • encryptor

        private org.springframework.security.crypto.encrypt.TextEncryptor encryptor

    • Constructor Detail

      • AES256EncryptionUtil

        public AES256EncryptionUtil​(@NonNull java.lang.String password,
                            @NonNull java.lang.String salt)
        Creates a new Instance with the given password and salt.
        SpringFramework's BytesEncryptor says: "The provided salt is expected to be hex-encoded; it should be random and at least 8 bytes in length. Also applies a random 16 byte initialization vector to ensure each encrypted message will be unique. Requires Java 6."
        Caution: The salt has to be in hex format and has to have an even number of characters.
        Parameters:
        password - the password used to generate the encryptor's secret key; should not be shared
        salt - a hex-encoded, random, site-global salt value to use to generate the key

    • Method Detail

      • encrypt

        public @NonNull java.lang.String encrypt​(@NonNull java.lang.String text)
        Uses the TextEncryptor.encrypt(String) method to encrypt the given text.
        Specified by:
        encrypt in interface EncryptionUtil
        Parameters:
        text - the String to encrypt
        Returns:
        the encrypted String

      • encrypt

        public static @NonNull java.lang.String encrypt​(@NonNull java.lang.String password,
                                                @NonNull java.lang.String salt,
                                                @NonNull java.lang.String text)
        Encrypts the given text with the given password and salt. Encrypted text is hex-encoded.
        Caution: The salt has to be in hex format and has to have an even number of characters.
        Parameters:
        password - the password used to generate the encryptor's secret key; should not be shared
        salt - a hex-encoded, random, site-global salt value to use to generate the key
        text - the text to encrypt
        Returns:
        the encrypted text in hexadecimal format
        See Also:
        decrypt(String, String, String), AES256EncryptionUtil(String, String)

      • decrypt

        public @Nullable java.lang.String decrypt​(@NonNull java.lang.String text)
        Uses the TextEncryptor.decrypt(String) method to decrypt the given encrypted text.
        Specified by:
        decrypt in interface EncryptionUtil
        Parameters:
        text - the String to decrypt
        Returns:
        the decrypted String or null, if the decryption failed

      • decrypt

        public static @Nullable java.lang.String decrypt​(@NonNull java.lang.String password,
                                                 @NonNull java.lang.String salt,
                                                 @NonNull java.lang.String encryptedText)
        Decrypts the given text (has to be hex-coded) with the provided password and salt.
        Caution: The salt has to be in hex format and has to have an even number of characters.
        Parameters:
        password - the password used to generate the encryptor's secret key; should not be shared
        salt - a hex-encoded, random, site-global salt value to use to generate the key
        encryptedText - the encrypted text to decrypt
        Returns:
        the decrypted text
        See Also:
        encrypt(String, String, String)
